title: Jones Lab Handbook
text:
How to edit this book
This book is created using Quarto, “An open-source scientific and technical publishing system”. The files used to generate the web book you’re looking at are housed on GitHub in this repository. You have a couple of options if you’d like to edit this book, but both of them require at minimum that you have a GitHub account.
If you have a simple edit to the text, you can click the “Edit This Page” button in the upper right corner of any page of this book. That will take you to a GitHub page where you can edit the text using markdown syntax to indicate formatting.
If you have more complex changes to make, or want to take advantage of something like the markdown Visual Editor mode in RStudio, you’ll need to fork and clone the GitHub repository. Don’t worry if you don’t know what any of that means—there are detailed instructions here.

title: 3  Untitled
text: Detailed step-by-step instructions (with screenshots) on how to fork, clone, make a PR, etc. with RStudio and usethis.

title: Jones Lab Handbook
text:
How was this book made?
This book is created using Quarto, “An open-source scientific and technical publishing system”. The files used to generate the web book you’re looking at are housed on GitHub and are automatically rendered and deployed as this website! If you’d like to contribute and edit this book, a simple option is to click the “Edit This Page” button on any page of this book. More detailed instructions on how to contribute are in the Appendix.

title: 4  Contributing
text:
Detailed step-by-step instructions (with screenshots) on how to fork, clone, make a PR, etc. with RStudio and usethis.

title: 4  Offboarding
text:
Offboarding is important to our group because we want to get feedback and also not lose your data and stuff
Steps to take:

Make sure all of your code is in repositories in the Jones Lab GitHub organization
Make sure each project has a README file explaining what it is, how to reproduce results, and includes metadata for any data collected (e.g. what do column names mean and what units are they in?)
Schedule an exit interview
More steps
